FileHandler module

class FileHandler.FileHandler(path=None, mode=None, fileName='file_0', format=None, patientData=None)[source]

Bases: object

A class to handle files

…

Attributes

path: str

path to the file to be read or written

mode: str

mode of the object, either read or write

fileName: str

name of the file to be written

format: str

format of the file to be written

patientData: any

data to be read from or written to the file

Methods

ReadMode():

returns a class obejct in read mode

WriteMode():

returns a class object in write mode

mode():

returns the mode of the object

mode(value):

sets the mode of the object

path():

returns the path of the object

path(value):

sets the path of the object

fileName():

returns the name of the file to be written

fileName(value):

sets the name of the file to be written

fileformat():

return the format of the file

fileformat(value):

sets the format of the file

readFile():

reads data from a file and returns a dataframe

formatData():

the read data stored as dataFrame is formatted to a list

writeFile(data):

writes the input data into a file

validateData():

classmethod ReadMode(path)[source]

classmethod

Args:

path (str): path to the file to be read

Returns:

FileHandler: class object in read mode with the path to the respective file

classmethod

Args:

path (str): _description_ fileName (str): _description_ format (str): _description_ pData (any): _description_

Returns:

FileHandler: class object in write mode with the path, fileName, format and patient data for the respective file to be written

formatData(includeFirstRow: bool)[source]

formats the read data to a list and transforms it to a VPCData object

Raises:

ValueError: object has to be in read mode

Returns:

dataFrame (float): the read data as a list

property mode

Returns:

mode (str): string of the object’s mode

property path

path (str): path of the object

readFile()[source]

reads from a file and stores the data in it

Raises:

ValueError: object has so be in read mode FileNotFoundError: objects path has to be valid ValueError: file of the specified path must have a format TypeError: objects format is unknown, data can’t be read

validateData()[source]

TODO read dataFrame / patientData and discard rows, if they are not fully populated think of way other than discarding incomplete data

writeFile(data)[source]

write a file with given data

Args:

data (_type_): input data to be written to a file

Raises:

ValueError: object has to be in write mode TypeError: file format of the file to be written can only be one of the supported ones (Excel, xml, csv)
